meanings.definition: To select and swear in a jury.
meanings.sent1: The judge was empaneling the jury for the trial.
meanings.sent2: The court was empaneling a group of citizens to serve as jurors.
meanings.sent3: Empaneling the jury turned into a comedy of errors when the wrong people were selected.
meanings.sent4: The process of empaneling the jury felt like assembling a puzzle of diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The act of empaneling the jury was crucial for ensuring a fair trial.

meanings.definition: To enroll or enlist someone for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The school was empaneling students for the science fair.
meanings.sent2: The organization was empaneling volunteers to help with the event.
meanings.sent3: Empaneling participants for the race became a race in itself.
meanings.sent4: She felt like empaneling him for the project was akin to inviting chaos.
meanings.sent5: Empaneling individuals with diverse skills was key to the success of the team project.
